title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Monday 2 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: 'unknown substance ' in envelope sent to council .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for regular updates us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the east midlands .
updates on breaking news will continue to appear throughout the night .

documents.title: weather : cloudy overnight with rain possible
text: it 'll remain windy overnight with cloudy conditions and the chance of a shower .
skies will become clearer in the early hours .
lows of 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: man tried to grab woman in city street
text: a man allegedly tried to grab a 19-year-old woman as she walked along a street in derby city centre .
police said the teenager was approached by a man in willow row at about 20:45 on 20 september .
he made a number of inappropriate comments and went to grab her - but she avoided his grip and got away .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: arrest made after gun fired
text: a man has been arrested after a gun was fired in mansfield .
officers were called to gladstone street shortly after midnight on wednesday last week .
a woman was treated for injuries not thought to be serious and discharged from hospital .
a 21-year-old man remains in custody on sus of grievous bodily harm .

documents.title: 'bright new era ' for taxis in nottingham
text: it 's been claimed that nottingham will have `` the newest and most economical fleet '' of taxis anywhere in the country within three years .
the city council has confirmed plans to have 32 electric charging points in eight locations around the city by next year .
they wo n't be dedicated for taxis at first but will be once demand increases .

nottingham city council is also trying to remove obstacles for taxi drivers to convert their vehicles to low-emission and is bidding for government funding for ten electric cabs which will be leased to drivers .
this is the beginning of a new dawn for taxi services in nottingham .
in the next few years , we will see the fleet of hackney cabs transformed to clean , modern re-branded vehicles and uniformed drivers fully trained in customer service . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: power cut in chesterfield
text: looks like those affected should n't have to wait too long for electricity to return .
we are aware of a # powercut in the # chesterfield # s42 and surrounding area .
we aim to restore all supplies by 18:00 .
andi .
hi , i 'm from the derbyshire times newspaper in chesterfield .
do you know what caused last night 's power cut .
thanks ashley .
hi ashley , the power cut was caused by a tree branch that had blown onto an overhead power line .
all electricity supplies back after 30 mins
thank you for your help , it 's much appreciated .
no problem .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'harmless ' substance causes hours of disruption
text: the working day returned to normal at melton borough council this afternoon after several hours of disruption caused by an `` unknown substance '' found inside an envelope .
staff were evacuated from the building on burton street this morning over concerns about the substance .
the emergency services were called to the scene including the hazardous area response team -paramedics specially trained to deal with major incidents .
leicestershire police carried out tests on the substance , which was found to be harmless .
the cordon was then removed and staff were allowed to return to their office .
police said their investigations are ongoing and could n't say what the substance was or if it was sent maliciously .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'disgusting handling ' of monarch collapse
text: a range of opinions on our facebook pages about monarch going out of business .
garry belmore wrote : `` my daughter booked her honeymoon last week .
got distraught message at 5.47 all staff and reps were pulled out of manchester airport no one to answer questions .
`` its cost her £ 300 to get another flight and £ 70 for another nights stay at the hotel .
disgusting handling of the situation does not cover it. ``
julie wilmot posted : `` it 's being handled exactly as it should be- chartered aircraft to bring people home as a priority .
it 's life- the same risk as if you order a car and the dealership goes bust .
`` we rebooked with ryanair with no inflated prices at 520 this morning . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: your photos : apple ducks in halloughton
text: how do you like them apples ? !
thanks to karen 's garden in halloughton , southwell , for the
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'city for title & palace down ' - study
text: 'city for title & palace down ' - study
author: Matt Davis
BBC Sport

documents.title: police dog continues to improve after life-saving op
text: a police dog which required a life-saving operation on a twisted colon is `` looking brighter every day '' , his handlers have said .
nottinghamshire 's pd kyle needed hours of emergency surgery after falling ill last week .
the force said the four-year-old has been slowly improving ever since and should hopefully be well enough to return home from the vet later this week .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shrewsbury 's jules faces long spell out
text: shrewsbury 's jules faces long spell out

documents.title: man jailed for murdering wife
text: a 39-year-old man has been sentenced to life in prison after pleading guilty to murdering his wife .
baldeep singh from dovedale road in thurmaston admitted killing 35-year-old amandeep kaur as he believed she was going to leave him .
singh called police in february to confess to the murder - when officers arrived at the house they found amandeep dead in her bedroom .
a post-mortem examination revealed she died as a result of a laceration to the neck .
singh will serve at least 19 years before being considered for release .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: m1 fuel spill clean-up complete
text: good news , m1 fans .
carriageway clean-up complete + all lanes now open on # m1 j28/ # a38 roundabout following a large fuel spill .
delays on approach from # a38 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'sus substance sent to council hq was harmless
text: staff at melton borough council have been allowed back into the building after it was evacuated earlier when an envelope was found to contain a sus substance .
leicestershire police said tests had revealed the substance was harmless .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ex-care home worker denies abusing boys
text: an 83-year-old derby man has pleaded not guilty to 24 historical sexual offence charges against 10 boys at two care homes .
norman sully , of chaddesden , appeared at derby crown court but could not get into the dock as he uses a mobility scooter .
he answered not guilty '' to all the allegations from a position near the witness box .
his trial , which is expected to last about six weeks , was adjourned and will be held at birmingham crown court on 9 april 2018 .
mr sully was given unconditional bail .
defence barrister will bennett told the court mr sully 's defence will be that `` it did n't happen '' .
of the 24 charges , 19 are allegations concerning seven boys at the elmhurst family centre in derby , between 1 january 1973 and 31 december 1980 .
the others are alleged to have happened at bracken house in nottingham between 1 september 1976 and 10 july 1978 .
twenty-three are indecent assault charges .
one is an attempted serious sexual assault .
author: Mike O'Sullivan
Reporter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: m1 lane closed after fuel spill
text: a lane is closed on the roundabout between the m1 j28 and the a38 due to a large spill caused by a broken-down vehicle .
highways england says it 's expecting delays until 16:00 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'large-scale cordon ' at council office
text: jamie , from melton , walked past the council offices earlier and described the scene .
he said : `` there appears to be a large-scale cordon around the council offices and a hive of activity from the fire brigade and ambulance service .
`` there 's probably about eight or nine police cars .
a lot of them [ police officers ] appear to be stationed outside and not actually moving - there are a few going in and out of the building but they appear to be standing around at the moment . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire crew at scene of evacuation
text: the fire service is among the emergency crews at melton borough council offices .
it has posted these messages on twitter about its involvement .
2/2 the building whilst we work to identify the substance .
thanks to all for your ongoing patience .
# 999family @ twitterid @ twitterid
we 're working with @ twitterid @ twitterid at an incident involving an unknown substance at their offices .
the council have evacuated 1/2
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man died from neck injuries on inflatable dinghy ride
text: a coroner 's court has heard how a father-of-three from leicestershire died from neck injuries on an inflatable ride during a holiday in kefalonia .
the inquest at leicester town hall heard how 57-year-old simon crewe from whetstone was one of three men riding on an inflatable towed by a speedboat in may this year .
the coroner , catherine mason recorded a narrative conclusion .
`` during the ride one of the other participants catapulted in the air and then impacted with mr crewe .
as a result of the impact mr crewe sustained fatal neck injuries . ''
author: Victoria Hicks
Reporter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: council office closed following envelope delivery
text: melton borough council has just posted this message on twitter about the delivery of an envelope containing a sus substance .
we 're working with the emergency services to manage an incident meaning our offices are currently closed .
we 're sorry for any inconvenience
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: envelope substance to be tested by police
text: staff at melton borough council are still not allowed to enter their building on burton street after an envelope containing an `` unknown substance '' was opened .
emergency services were called earlier today and remain at the site .
leicestershire police have said tests will be carried out on the substance .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: actress feared brother had been caught in las vegas attack
text: panic followed by relief for the this is england star , who comes from smalley in derbyshire .
heart drops when i heard about vegas knowing my brother is there travelling !
found he left yday !
unbelievable what happens in this world
so glad your brother is .
safe .
it 's absolutely heartbreaking to hear and see .
praying for all that have been affected in any way .
watching the scenes on tv this morning , awful , our hearts go out to the victims
i agree with you on that one , nothing will stop us around the world from carrying on being normal and will make us all stronger too
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sus envelope sent to melton council
text: melton borough council 's offices were evacuated this morning when an envelope containing an `` unknown substance '' was opened .
staff contacted police after opening the envelope this morning .
police remain at the site .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: long eaton tyre slashing rampage 'costs owners hundreds '
text: eight cars had their tyres slashed over two nights in long eaton last week .
police said vehicles were attacked in hawthorne avenue , myrtle avenue , wyvern avenue , lynden avenue and manchester street between tuesday evening and thursday morning .
sgt damien shannon said : the attacks seem to be completely without motive and acts of pure vandalism .
hundreds of pounds have had to be spent by the victims replacing the tyres . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: monarch collapse 'double whammy ' for couple
text: the collapse of the airline monarch this morning has made an already stressful holiday situation even worse for a leicester woman .
jessica has told the bbc : `` me and my boyfriend booked a holiday to barcelona a few months ago .
we had quite a small budget so booked a flight there with monarch and flight back with ryanair .
`` less than two weeks ago we got an email from ryanair to say that our flight was cancelled .

we booked return flights at an extra cost of £ 60 and hoped that was the worst , but on the way to the airport at 4am this morning we got a text from monach to say 'do n't go to the airport , all flights have been cancelled ' .
`` we 've had to rush to book new flights at even more expense and have now lost part of our holiday too . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: belarusian teen receives life-changing surgery in nottingham
text: a teenager from belarus is 9cm taller after receiving life-changing spinal surgery in nottingham .
anastaysia pilut , 14 , suffered from scoliosis , a severe curvature of the spine that would have led to her becoming severely disabled .

consultant masood shafafy heard of her plight from a charity that brings children to the uk from areas affected by the chernobyl disaster , and led his team in carrying out an 11-hour operation to straighten out her spine using metal rods .
mr shafafy said : `` she was in constant pain and by the time she reached 40 it is likely that the curve would have been at 90 degrees .
`` i was determined to help her when i heard about her story . ''
anastaysia spent seven weeks recuperating at the chesterfield home of her host family before flying home to belarus last week .
she said : `` i would like to say thank you to everyone who has helped me , from the charity and the hospital .
they have given me a future . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man killed 86-year-old after money row
text: man killed 86-year-old after money row

documents.title: man charged with etwall shop robbery
text: a 31-year-old man has been charged following a robbery in etwall in which a member of staff was tied up .
the man was arrested after cctv footage was released by police showing the raid at the one stop shop in main street on 27 september .
the man has been charged with robbery and handling stolen goods .
a 28-year-old man arrested on sus of robbery has been released while investigations continue .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police appeal after leicester burglary
text: police are asking for help to identify this woman after a laptop was stolen from a property on lincoln street in leicester .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: medical emergency on east midlands-bound flight
text: a plane flying from lanzarote to east midlands airport had to divert to gatwick last night after a passenger suffered a medical emergency .
thomas cook said the passenger was given treatment and the plane then took off again and landed at east midlands airport only about 10 minutes later than its scheduled arrival time .
the company did not give any further information on the nature of the medical emergency .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car crashes through school fence
text: a car has ploughed into a school fence in the clarendon park area of leicester .
police told the bbc they were called to the crash at about 21:20 on saturday night .
there were two vehicles involved but luckily no one was injured .
there were also no arrests made .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new fairground rides at goose fair
text: if you 're one of those thrill seekers that goes on the fairground rides at nottingham 's goose fair you might be pleased to hear about new rides at the event this year .
this is called the loopfighter .
this is the take off .
before now the rides were in dubai - it 's thought this will be their first appearance in the uk .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mansfield tops county 'fat list '
text: newly compiled figures show that mansfield is officially the fattest part of nottinghamshire .
the bbc research , using public health england data , shows more than 70 % of adults in the town are at least overweight and one in three are obese
more than 40 % of adults across the country are overweight and almost a quarter are obese .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: monarch stopped flying from east midlands airport in 2015
text: if you were wondering whether the collapse of monarch airlines is affecting people at east midlands airport , the answer is no - the company has n't used the airport since 2015 .
however , the airline has been a regular fixture at manchester and birmingham airports so many passengers from the east midlands will have seen their flights cancelled .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing teenager found by police
text: police say 13-year-old nottingham girl precious harris , who went missing with her sister tiayana on saturday , has now been located .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bakewell divided over bridge 's love locks
text: hundreds of so-called love locks that have been added to a bridge in derbyshire are dividing opinion locally .
in recent years , dozens of loved-up couples have written their names on padlocks and fastened them to the weir bridge in bakewell .
while some feel the gesture , which copies similar displays in cities around the world , is romantic , others have complained the padlocks are an eyesore .
one facebook commenter said : `` they look awful and are blocking a lovely view of the river . ''
another comment suggested the `` beautiful bridge '' had been `` ruined by idiots '' .
but others love it - i spoke to one woman at the bridge who liked the idea of couples adding a padlock at the start of their relationship and then returning years later to see if it was still there .
the trend appears to be spreading - the locks have started pop up on a nearby bridge too .
author: Wesley Mallin
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: 'more money ' for northern powerhouse rail
text: chancellor philip hammond is to announce an extra £ 300m to improve rail links in northern england , in a speech to the conservative party conference .
the new money will be used to ensure hs2 will link to faster trains between liverpool and manchester , sheffield , leeds and york - so-called northern powerhouse rail .
mr hammond will say cities in the east midlands , such as leicester , would also benefit from the new cash .

this investment will go towards ensuring hs2 infrastructure can link up with future northern powerhouse and midlands rail projects - helping the towns and cities of the north reach their full potential . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: concern for missing nottingham girl
text: police are becoming `` increasingly concerned '' for a 13-year-old girl missing in nottingham .
precious harris has n't been seen since saturday .
her sister tiayna , who went missing at the same time , has been found .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: win house with £ 5 raffle ticket
text: you could be the owner of this three bedroom terrace house in wigston for the price of a nice lunch .
the current owner is selling raffle tickets for the house for just £ 5 each but he needs to sell 60,000 of them for the draw to go ahead .
if amit sehgal can not sell enough tickets then a draw will be made for a cash prize of £ 300 instead .
he said the house has been valued at about £ 145,000 .
i thought that it was a property that i wanted to sell so why not raffle the property off .
let a family live free of a mortgage . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: parking prices set to rise at derbyshire attractions
text: car parking charges at some of derbyshire 's countryside sites could be increased by as much as 14 % next year .
the increase would affect anyone parking at elvaston castle , black rocks and middleton top .
the county council says it wants to bring its charges into line with similar car parks not owned by the authority .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: national trust still seeking peak district tenant
text: the national trust continues to look for a new tenant for its land in the peak district after it ended a lease to a grouse shooting firm in 2016 .
it follows cases of wildlife persecution in parts of north derbyshire , which one wildlife group has branded `` a disgrace '' .
the trust says it has n't ruled out allowing shoots to happen on its land in the future but says its main aim is to preserve the land it owns for visitors to enjoy .
the issue will be explored on tonight 's inside out east midlands on bbc one at 19:30 .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: rush hour traffic round-up
text: no major problems on the regions 's roads this morning but highways england is reporting delays in the following spots :
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: flights cancelled as monarch airline ceases trading
text: the british airline monarch has been placed into administration and all flights have been cancelled .
about 110,000 people have been left abroad - the civil aviation authority has said they will be flown home at no extra cost .
about 300,000 future bookings have been cancelled including the flight booked by dominic topliss from hucknall .
he was due to fly from birmingham to tenerife with monarch on saturday for his birthday .
he said the whole situation is a `` nightmare '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : today 's weather for the east midlands
text: here 's the outlook for monday .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: leicester space scientist wins bbc two astronaut show
text: a leicester scientist has said she is `` excited '' she could `` end up in space '' after winning a bbc two show .
suzie imber was revealed as the best candidate for space on `` astronauts : do you have what it takes ? ''
last night .
the 33-year-old university of leicester associate professor said the experience was `` incredible '' but `` really tough '' .
dr imber , who triumphed over 11 other people , will now get a recommendation to join the european space agency .
author: Sonia Kataria
BBC News Online

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning - i 'll be looking after your east midlands live page today along with gavin bevis .
we 'll keep you updated with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the region .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
